multiple-choice.question: What is a key similarity between elephants and humans, according to the speaker?

options.label: B
options.text: Dominant calves are more social, while lower-ranking calves are more solitary.

options.label: C

options.label: D

options.label: A
options.text: Socializing with dominant calves leads to more aggression.

options.label: B
options.text: Socializing with dominant calves leads to more socialization.

options.label: C
options.text: Socializing with lower-ranking calves leads to more socialization.

options.label: D
options.text: Socializing with dominant calves has no effect on socialization.

multiple-choice.question: What is a common behavior among young male elephants, as described by the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: They are very social and stay close to their mothers.

options.label: B
options.text: They are very independent and spend more time away from their mothers.

options.label: C
options.text: They are very aggressive and fight with each other.

options.label: D
options.text: They are very timid and avoid social interactions.

multiple-choice.question: What is a key lesson that can be learned from elephant social behavior, according to the speaker?

options.label: A
options.text: That social hierarchy is always a good thing.

options.label: B
options.text: That social hierarchy can be beneficial, but also has its downsides.

options.label: C
options.text: That social hierarchy is not important in elephant societies.

options.label: D
options.text: That social hierarchy is only relevant in human societies.

multiple-choice.question: What is the speaker's hope for how humans will view and treat elephants after learning about their social behavior?

options.label: A
options.text: That humans will view elephants as just animals and not as individuals.

options.label: B
options.text: That humans will view elephants as just entertainment and not as individuals.

options.label: C
options.text: That humans will view elephants as individuals deserving of attention and protection.

options.label: D
options.text: That humans will view elephants as just a food source and not as individuals.
